content.description:
P1. Climb a rather run out slab slinging trees for protection where available. Belay from a clump of trees 5.3 60 Feet. 

  P2. Continue up the slabs through some overlaps and flakes until you get to the head wall. Pull the mantle(Crux. Going left may be easier but dirty).....Now stay "Steady as a Rock" and climb the slab past 4 more bolts to the anchors 5.9 90 Feet
content.protection: Standard rack. Some bolts.... Ring anchors on top of pitch 2.
content.location: 20 feet left of Old Route. Start from a perch shared with a living tree and a dead tree at the base of a clean streak up the slab. Can be run in one long pitch. Can rap with a 60m down to the tree belay and then rap the first pitch to the ground

content.description: The Left Wing has one recorded route as of now, but has potential for more routes with some cleaning.
